channel.title: Html
channel.description:
I just have a quick question please don't flame i love everyone <3 :P
I made a few htmls for my rsps but idk how to make it into a real website like how do i code it so someone could type happybunnybearfishfrog.com and it goes to that website!?

item.title: Html
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

I’m not very good with websites either.

You’d have to use File Manager to upload your html documents to your webhost database. There is a folder named public_html or something in there. Go inside that folder and then upload your html documents. Then whenever you go to your URL you’ll see that.

If you wanted to make something like forums, make a folder called Forums or something and then upload forum software into it. Then, when you type in the URL www.website.com/Forums, it will pop up with your forums.

Watch some YouTube videos on how to setup a basic webhost/website. They’ll tell you a lot if you’re confused.

Read full topic

item.title: Html
item.dc:creator: @modzilla modzilla
item.description:
@modzilla wrote:

Haha this is all a foreign language to me so if i did the x10host i would beable to use my code for the website i have and it will look just like that? that sound right?

Read full topic

item.title: Html
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

No, websites such as 000webhost and x10hosting are considered webhosts. These are free and there are many more out there, but there are also more reliable ones out there you can pay for. Beware that publicly hosting any source of an RS client on x10 will have them ban you.

All dot.tk does is give you a free .tk domain (domains are the URL extensions like .com, .org, .net, etc.)

Here is kind of a rundown:

  1. You make a database at 000webhost or another webhost, you get a website such as modzilla.comeze.com or something.
  2. You upload files to this database to show on your webpage, such as forum software, homepages, etc. You can use directories to make different things, such as modzilla.comeze.com being your homepage and then modzilla.comeze.com/Forums would be your forums (after you’ve uploaded your forum software to the website).
  3. Then if you wanted it to be Modzilla.tk for the URL, you would use dot.tk to do that.

This is more of a general question.

Read full topic

item.title: Html
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

modzilla:

what if i used the .tk?

Set it up so that it redirects to your IP, and set up a program like WAMP. Then portforward and do everything you need to do so that others can connect to your webserver.

Or you could use a webhost.
